info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL NORTHUMBERLAND... EASTERN MONTOUR AND CENTRAL COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 729 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bloomsburg, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Bloomsburg, Danville, Elysburg, Riverside, Catawissa, Lightstreet, Almedia, Fernville, Mechanicsville, Buckhorn, Numidia, Jerseytown, Rupert, Slabtown, Mainville, Eyers Grove, Knoebels Grove, Espy, Millville and Lime Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
